Name: AP® Chemistry Crash Course Book + Online (Advanced Placement (AP) Crash Course)

ReviewList.Text: I received this book on Friday and have not had a chance for my students to look through it. However, I was thrilled to see that it is indeed updated for the new test format. Most of the study books are not. This book is written by an experienced AP Chem teacher, with many tips for students throughout the sections. This is one book that I will recommend to my students.

So far, so good!  It's the only book I've reviewed for my students that actually aligns with the new curriculum, labs included.  So many mainstream books advertised that they were updated for the new curriculum, yet included the old list of labs and reduced practice multiple choice to four answers.  Not much of an update if you ask me!  This book is legit.  Bare bones review of the essentials.  If you focus on what Adrian has presented here, you should be in great shape!  Helped me as a teacher to sift through the new curriculum as well!

I have an AP chemistry teacher that I learn insufficiently with. This book has helped me very much. I wish I would've ordered it sooner and earlier in the year. Each chaper is simplified as much as possible and it's easy to learn from. It offers usually 2 to 4 practice problems. So one might have to look some up online if additional practice is needed. Overall, I highly reccomend it!

I'm an AP Chem teacher-  I LOVE the book!  The content is spot on for test material.  I was disappointed that there are only a few practice questions. Test prep requires test practice.  This is not the traditional  test prep book- it's strictly content with only one or two questions per topic.  It would have been better with at least one  practice test in the book itself.  * The online practice test needs much work- FR questions instructions are for the old format.  Test does not have rigor of real  AP exams.  Questions are awkwardly  worded where diagrams clearly belong in MC.  Shy on rigorous questions relevant to particle diagrams, graphs, and charts.  Wording in some questions  was not AP style-  "comment on" in the free response rather than "explain" or  "justify" -the closer the practice is to the test, the better instrument it is.  "Diagnostics "  online are inaccurate, too broad or do not exist.  I would not give the online test to my students nor suggest that they purchase other practice quizzes at the REA site- they are out of date on content, though I would have them buy the book for reference.
Great book! Saved me two weeks before the exam since my barrons ap chemistry stufy guide wasnt updated. Really useful!

I will be recommending this book for my students stating on day one.  With AP test readers spending a little less than one minute per free response question, I want my students to get right to the heart of the question in two sentences.  With Adrian's book as a homework guide, my students will gain that confidence not to fill their test booklet with written diarrhea.
Short sweet and to the point. The guy that writes these books is really good at predicting what's going to be on the AP for that year.

My daughter just prepped for her AP this year and said the book was extremely helpful. She mentioned that some of the kids in her class who didn't have this book were commenting that it was a better prep book than the ones they had.

Some of my students used this book to review for the exam.  It is just the test was different from what any of us anticipated.  It was much better than the other books that were available for the 2013-14 school year
Although small this book provides ample informationon everything one needs to kow for the new and revised AP Test. I would highly recommend this!
Just the basics - Helped me secure a 4 on the exam by just going through it the days before the exam

Yeaaaahh, not nearly as phenomenal as I was hoping or expecting.  Personally, I was a die-hard Princeton Review fan and loved their test prep book that was published before the change in the AP Chem curriculum.  In the PR, there was a test at the end of each unit in addition to two full length practice exams with answers AND explanations.  In this book, you'll get a couple of questions at the end of each chapter and one full length test that you must log onto a computer and take.  Not convenient, at least for me. Bottom line: If you know nearly all of the AP Chem content and need the tiniest of refreshing, then this book is for you.  If you want more that two questions per topic, go with a different prep book.
incomplete and found it in my opinion not as described.  ended up purchasing barron's book
I bought this for a 10th grader. She said that it really helped her prepare for her AP test and that she wanted to buy the books for this years AP test as well.
Good book. Wish it had more actual problems to work and review. Have not used to online quiz yet.

I found this book to be a very good overview for everything I have learned in chemistry. I read through the entire thing last week in preparation for today and can say that it really helped me build my conceptual understanding greatly, and although it just brushed over the math portions quickly, it really helped broaden my overall understanding of chemistry. There were a few grammatical mistakes, repetitions, and a couple of factual mistakes, but they were not a big deal at all and very easy to distinguish.
Not much I for worth reporting. Tried it as an additional resource but I don't think worth it.
